title: ice_shaver
body:
A kitchen appliance that makes [[shaved ice]].

The classic ice shaver that often appears in fan art is a hand-cranked machine which rotates a block of ice on top of a fixed blade, with the shavings then falling into a bowl underneath. Modern versions are electrically powered, and are often technically ice [i]crushers[/i] rather than traditional shavers.

h4. See also

* [[shaved ice]]

title: hawker_harrier
body:
The Harrier Jump Jet is a family of military [[VTOL]] fighter aircraft originally designed in the UK and later co-developed by British and American companies to project air power despite poor or absent airfield conditions.

Some of the common details between models are the notable anhedral (downward) angles of the wings and tailplanes, the large engine air intakes and cockpit canopy, the rotating engine nozzles (two on each side of the fuselage instead of large ones at the rear like most other fighters) and the outrigger-style landing gear. 

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Harrier Jump Jet":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harrier_Jump_Jet

body:
A widebody tri[[jet]] produced by American manufacturer McDonnell Douglas in the 1970s. title: de_havilland_vampire
body:
The [b]de Havilland DH.100 Vampire[/b] was a British subsonic fighter [[jet]] developed and manufactured by the [i]de Havilland[/i] British jet company. Having been developed during the Second World War to harness the newly developed jet engine, the Vampire entered service with the Royal Air Force (RAF) in 1945. 

The Royal Air Force used the Vampire as a front line fighter until 1953 before it assumed secondary roles such as pilot training. It was retired by the RAF in 1966. It achieved several aviation firsts and records, including being the first jet aircraft to cross the Atlantic Ocean. 

The Vampire had many export sales and was operated by various air forces. Almost 3,300 Vampires were manufactured, a quarter of them built under license in several countries. Some of its former operators were [[Canada]], [[Austria]], [[Norway]], [[New Zealand]], [[Japan]], [[Mexico]], [[Venezuela]], etc.

It participated in subsequent conflicts such as the 1948 Arab–Israeli War, the Malayan emergency and the Rhodesian Bush War.
other_names: デ・ハビランド・バンパイア

title: bf_110
body:
The Messerschmitt Bf-110 [i]Zerstörer[/i] ("Destroyer") was a twin-engined, twin-tailed heavy fighter used by Luftwaffe during [[wwwii|World War II]]. Originally designed as a three-seat escort and interdiction [[aircraft]], its poor showing in the "Battle of Britain":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Britain against single-engined fighters like the [[supermarine spitfire|Supermarine Spitfire]] and [[hawker hurricane|Hawker Hurricane]] relegated it to other roles. It went on to serve in many theaters as a night fighter, bomber interceptor, and attack aircraft.

The Bf-110 commonly carried whatever was considered a "heavy gun" at the time in its nose (2 20mm or 30mm cannon, later including an optional undernose gun pod). Early models were able to carry 4 250kg bombs on the outer wings, while later versions could carry two 250kg or 500kg bombs near the wing roots. Some versions meant for bomber interception also carried two or four "WGr21":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Werfer-Granate_21 air-to-air rockets.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia Page":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messerschmitt_Bf_110

title: fw_190
body:
A [[World War II|World War II]] German fighter-bomber produced by Focke-Wulf Flugzeugbau AG. It had wide-track landing gear and a rearward-sliding raised canopy. Initial models had a short, tightly cowled nose housing a "radial engine":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radial_engine; later ones (the D and Ta 152 series) had longer noses with liquid-cooled inline engines (see post #520843 for a comparison). They also had lengthened fuselages and longer wings. 

The Fw 190 could carry combinations of nose- and wing-mounted 13mm [[machine_gun|machine guns]] and/or 20mm [[cannon]]. Some had a 30mm [i]Motorkanone[/i] firing through the propeller hub, while the ground attack versions could carry rockets or bombs. The [i]Würger[/i] ("Shrike" or "Butcher Bird") could also carry external fuel tanks.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* [[Bf 109]]
* [[Ta 152]]
* [[supermarine spitfire|Supermarine Spitfire]]
* Wikipedia: "Focke-Wulf Fw 190":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Focke-Wulf_Fw_190

title: tales_of_the_abyss
body:
The eighth mothership title in Namco's [[tales of (series)|Tales Series]]. Devolped by [[Tales of Symphonia|Team Symphonia]], Tales of the Abyss follows the story of the young, secluded noble, [[Luke fon Fabre]], on a journey of political and religious intrigue that changes his attitude about himself and other people for the better. It was released in Japan on the [[Playstation 2]] on December 15, 2005, and in North America on October 10, 2006.

Recently received a straight [[Nintendo 3DS]] port in Japan on June 30, 2011, and was released for the first time in Europe on November 24, 2011. The North American version of the 3DS port was later released on [[valentine|Feburary 14]], 2012.

body:
Fon Master [[Ion (tales)|]]'s bodyguard in [[Tales of the Abyss]]. Anise is a spunky girl who manipulates her doll [[Tokunaga (tales)|]] to grow in size and aid her in battle. Anise acts cheerful and bright, but has a hidden devious nature, especially when it comes to making money, marrying a wealthy man, or bribing her teammates. Her seiyuu is [[Momoi Haruko]].

title: sync_(tales)
body:
One of the Six God Generals in [[Tales of the Abyss]], a quick-footed fighter who always wears a mask until [[Guy Cecil]] destroys it. Sync is very cold and ruthless, showing total disregard for others' lives and feelings. In his final battle, Sync even wants to destroy the world that would give birth to a monster like himself.

[spoiler]He is the fifth replica of the original Fon Master Ion, but was considered 'garbage' and thrown into a volcano.[/spoiler]

She is commonly represented as a [[horse girl]] with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] in [[low twintails]], wearing an oufit inspired by the carriage she was pulling, complete with a LED star dangling from [b]her left ear[/b].

title: hector_rivera

He's portrayed as a walking [[skeleton]] with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], a [[goatee]] and [[brown eyes]]. He wears tattered clothes, a [[bandana]] and a [[straw hat]].

[spoiler]As it turns out, he's the patriarch of the Rivera family and Miguel's great-grandfather. He was married to [[Imelda Rivera]] and he's the father of [[Mama Coco]]. He was murdered by [[Ernesto de la Cruz]], his musical partner and childhood friend.[/spoiler]

title: final_yamato
body:
[b]Final Yamato[/b] (宇宙戦艦ヤマト・完結編, [i]Uchuu Senkan Yamato: Kanketsu Hen[/i], lit. "Space Battleship Yamato: Final Saga") is an anime movie sequel of the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] [[military]] [[science fiction]] TV series that was released during 1983 in [[Japan]].

The Space Battleship Yamato saga (known as [[uchuu_senkan_yamato|Star Blazers]] in the United States) ended in the [[1980s_(style)|80s]] with this film which was the fifth theatrical movie of the franchise.

At a running time of approximately 165 minutes, Final Yamato currently holds the record as being the longest running animated film ever made.

title: tron
body:
A [[Science fiction]] franchise from the 80s. 

The Tron franchise began in 1982 with the Walt Disney Pictures film [b]Tron[/b]. It was followed by various film tie-ins, [[video game]]s, a comic series and the 2010 sequel [[Tron: Legacy]]. More sequels are planned, and a television animated series entitled [[Tron: Uprising]] premiered on Disney XD in June 2012.

The name TRON was borrowed from the TRON command used in the early versions of the computer programming language BASIC. TRON stood for TRace ON, which prompted the program to print or display line numbers for each command line of a program as it ran, in order to assist in the debugging of the program.

title: encanto
body:
Encanto is a 2021 American computer-animated musical fantasy comedy film produced by Walt [[Disney]] Animation Studios. 

The film follows a multigenerational [[Colombia]]n family, the Madrigals, led by a matriarch whose children and grandchildren—except for [[Mirabel Madrigal]]—receive magical gifts from a miracle that helps them serve the people in their rural community called the Encanto. When Mirabel learns that the family is losing their magic, she sets out to find out what is happening, and save her family and their magical house.

title: arhoangel
body:
Former Russian [[3D]] artist.

Deleted all accounts on 2021-05-01.

[quote]
h6.  Shutting down the Patreon page

I'm sure you noticed the lack of updates and content in the past months. So I don't see any reason to keep this page anymore. At the end of this month, all my accounts (patreon, twitter, and archives) will be deleted.

Sure, it's been a wonderful 4 years and I am really grateful for everything that you have done for me, but it looks like I was completely burned out.

Maybe I'll come back someday, but until then, I don't want to keep you waiting in vain.
[/quote]

title: taiki_shuttle_(racehorse)
body:
(March 23, 1994 - August 17, 2022)

Real Life American-born Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by Devil's Bag (Which makes Taiki Shuttle a grandson of Halo) and foaled by Welsh Muffin, he is renowned as the best miler of his generation. 

Taiki Shuttle was a flaxen chestnut (a chestnut with a light-colored mane and tail) with a large star marking on his forehead and a sock on his right hind leg.

Taiki Shuttle died on August 17, 2022 from heart failure caused by old age, he was 28.

title: anna_miller
body:
While Anna Miller originally was an 18th century English writer and salon hostess, there is also an "Anna Miller's" chain of restaurants in Hawaii and Japan, known for their breakfast menus and desserts.

Also notable in the restaurants in Japan are the uniforms of their [[waitress]]es. Such a uniform consists of a pink or orange overall-style dress (waistline cut to the [[breasts]]) with an attached [[apron]], a white [[blouse]], and a heart-shaped [[name tag]]. It is this uniform which this tag refers to.

Anna Miller's last restaurant in Japan closed down on August 31, 2022.

h4. See also

* [[Kobeya]] - another chain known for their waitress uniforms

title: nurarihyon
body:
A type of [[traditional youkai]]. It is also often interpreted as "The Supreme Commander of Youkai". In old literature, this name was only one of the common names for the mysterious slimy monsters.  In some old folklore stories,  a slippery sphere that appears in the sea was called Nurarihyon.

For unknown reasons, in the 18th century, this creature came to be portrayed as an old man with a large bald head like a gourd, wearing a kimono or monk's stole. "Toriyama Sekien":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toriyama_Sekien drew a picture of this youkai in his 1776 book [[Gazu Hyakki Yagyou]], and the folklorist "Fujisawa Morihiko":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%97%A4%E6%B2%A2%E8%A1%9B%E5%BD%A6] introduced it in his book published in 1929-30 by adding unsourced commentary to it: まだ宵の口の燈影にぬらりひよんと訪問する怪物の親玉 ("The boss of monsters unexpectedly slips into someone's house, being illuminated with a lamplight in the early evening.") A variety of people such as manga artists, novelists, and occult writers expanded the interpretations of this short paragraph by adding almost random commentary. [[Mizuki Shigeru]] integrated these commentaries and circulated it in his manga and anime, and thus the current Nurarihyon was born.

Nurarihyon in present times is explained in the following manner: He enters one's house from nowhere during the evening, and behaves like it's his own home drinking tea and tobacco. Because people do not notice him since they are too busy, or mistakenly think that he is the landlord, they cannot expel it. 

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nurarihyon
* "Zack Davisson's blog: ”Nurarihyon – The Slippery Gourd”":http://hyakumonogatari.com/2014/11/17/nurarihyon-the-slippery-gourd/

* [[Nurarihyon (gegege no kitarou)|]] ([[Gegege no Kitarou]])
* [[Nurarihyon (nurarihyon no mago)|]] ([[Nura Rikuo]]'s grandfather) ([[Nurarihyon no Mago]])
* [[Nurarihyon (gantz)|]] ([[GANTZ]])
* [[Nurarihyon (youkai watch)|]] ([[Youkai Watch]])
* [[Nurarihyon (monster girl encyclopedia)|]] ([[Monster Girl Encyclopedia]])

* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

title: magpie
body:
Scientific name: "[i]Pica pica[/i]":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eurasian_Magpie 
Other common names: Eurasian Magpie; European Magpie; Common Magpie
Japanese: カササギ (鵲) [i]kasasagi[/i]

A common bird in the [[Crow|Corvidae]] family, found throughout Europe and in much of Asia. There are many magpie species; use this tag for the Common Magpie, [i]Pica pica[/i].

The Common Magpie is black with a metallic green and violet iridescence; the belly and shoulders are white; the wings are black glossed with green or purple, while the primary flight feathers have white inner webs which are notable when the wing is open. The long, wedge-shaped tail is black, glossed with green and reddish purple. The legs and bill are black.

The magpie is one of the few species and the only bird to pass the "mirror test":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mirror_test].

h4. See also
* [[Azure-winged Magpie]]
* [[Black-throated Magpie-jay]]
* [[Taiwan Blue Magpie]]

title: sayuri_(doa)
body: Sayuri successfully trained as a nurse, and had a knack for making her patients feel comfortable. However, it is implied that she did her job too well, which caused her to be let go as her patients didn't want to leave. Eventually, she sought out the Venus Islands hoping to secure a job as its resident nurse, although she ended up getting a lot more than she bargained for when she was recruited for the local Venus Festival after nursing the islands' tenant from a bad case of heat stroke due to her ship running late on arrival.

title: kamen_comet
body:
A supporting character in the [[Kamen America (comic)|Kamen America]] comic series and the second member of the Kamen Corps. Her real name is Misha Lovacova. She is the younger sister of [[Hare Trigger]] from [[Black Hops]]. Their family owned a private military company called NINGEN. [[Kamen America|Carly]] first encountered Misha as an enemy when she intervened in a foreign conflict to save American missionaries captured by Russian forces in Toepkekistan. Misha was struck by debris from the same space probe as Carly, giving her fire resistance and the ability to project flames while in her transformed state. Also like Carly, Misha wants to be a fashion designer and help people.

Misha has [[yellow eyes]] and short [[black hair]] with an [[ahoge]]. When she transforms, her eyes turn [[orange eyes|orange]] and her hair turns [[red hair|red]].

title: komasan
body:
A [[traditional youkai]] in [[Youkai Watch]]. Voiced by [[Endou Aya]].

He originally haunted a [[komainu]] but left for the city when the shrine was demolished. He is confused and frightened by urban life and modern technology, but loves [[soft serve]] [[ice cream]].

He carries his belongings on his back in a [[furoshiki]], and in [[Youkai Watch 2]] also carries a [[coin purse]]. He can appear as a human by putting a [[leaf on head|leaf on his head]].

He frequently uses the word [i]mongee[/i] (meaning "amazing"/"extremely"/"wow!", similar to [i]sugoi[/i]) and ends sentences with [i]zura[/i].

title: tengu
body:
A Japanese [[traditional youkai]], generally seeing wearing the clothing of the "yamabushi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yamabushi] - practitioners of Shugendou ([[tokin hat]], yuigesa/[[pom_pom_(clothes)|pom-pommed]] sash, [[shakujou]], etc). They are also seen wearing [[tengu-geta]] and wielding [[hauchiwa]].

Usually they are depicted as humanoid ravens/crows (or [[yamabushi tengu|red-skinned humans with unusually long noses]] and wings, as seen on [[tengu mask]]s), though there are also those that look like white wolves (likely a remnant of the original Chinese [i]tiangou[/i], from which the kanji is taken from). They are associated with conceitedness and trickery.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tengu":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tengu
* "Wikipedia: Yamabushi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yamabushi
* "Image of yamabushi attire":http://www.onmarkproductions.com/html/shugendou.html#chart

title: karakasa_obake
body:
An umbrella [[traditional youkai]]. It has [[one-eyed|one eye]], a long [[tongue]] and a single foot. Also known as 唐傘小僧 ([i]Karakasa Kozou[/i], Karakasa Boy).

"Karakasa" is another word for 和傘, a traditional Japanese [[oil-paper umbrella]]. The word means "Chinese-style umbrella" in Japanese because it originated in China.

h4. See also

title: osakabe-hime_(mythology)
body:
A legendary nonhuman figure who dwelled in the "Himeji Castle":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Himeji_Castle].
She is usually depicted as a lady wearing [[layered kimono]]. Her apparent age, true age, true identity, abilities and personality vary depending on story.
Her name may have come from the "Osakabe shrine":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%95%B7%E5%A3%81%E7%A5%9E%E7%A4%BE], whose shinto deity is said to be the guardian of the castle.

title: deathwatch
body: A [[warhammer_40k|Warhammer 40,000]] faction that serves as the Chamber Militant of the Ordo Xenos branch of the [[Inquisition (warhammer)|]]. Members are [[adeptus_astartes|Space Marines]] recruited from various chapters, and are put through specialized and intensive training geared towards increasing their efficiency at killing the Imperium's many alien foes. Members will serve for a certain period before returning to their chapter. Their power armor is painted entirely black, save for a single pauldron that indicates what chapter they came from.

title: inquisition_(warhammer)
body:
"Innocence proves nothing."

The internal security apparatus of the [[imperium_of_man|Imperium of Man]], the Inquisition was founded at the end of the Horus Heresy and tasked with rooting out traitors and preventing rebellions. Inquisitors have extremely broad authority to carry out their work and are one of the few groups granted permission to call Exterminatus, the condemnation and subsequent destruction of entire worlds, and have gained a reputation for being quick to write planets off. As such, they are some of the most feared individuals within the Imperium.

The Inquisition is divided into three primary camps: The Ordo Hereticus, which investigates and roots out heretical and general rebellious activity within the Imperium, the Ordo Xenos, which investigates the numerous alien races that oppose the Imperium and work to counter their influence, and the Ordo Malleus, which investigates affairs concerning psykers, the Warp, and Chaos. Each has a "Chamber Militant" consisting of specialized armed forces. These, respectively, are the [[adepta_sororitas|Adepta Sororitas]], the [[Deathwatch]], and the Grey Knights. Numerous minor ordos exist, and the Inquisition is divided between equally numerous different schools of thought concerning how they should go about their duties.

Their icon is a stylized "I" with a skull in the middle, often written in text as "=][=".

title: blinx_the_time_sweeper
body: Blinx: The Time Sweeper is a platform game developed by Artoon and published by Microsoft Game Studios for the Xbox. Advertised as "The World's First 4-D Action Game", Blinx: The Time Sweeper focuses on the titular character, an anthropomorphic cat called Blinx, who is on a mission to prevent the end of World B1Q64 and rescue its princess from the evil Tom-Tom Gang. Blinx is outfitted with the TS-1000 Vacuum Cleaner, with which he can exert control over time itself through five unique "Time Controls": slowing time down, speeding time up, recording a moment in time, reversing time, and stopping time entirely. A sequel, Blinx 2: Masters of Time and Space, was released in 2004.

title: m142_himars
body:
The M142 High Mobility Artillery Rocket System (HIMARS) is a light multiple rocket launcher developed for the U.S. Army and mounted upon a wheeled U.S. Army M1140 truck frame.  It can carry a single ammunition pod consisting of either the 6-rocket Guided Multiple Launch Rocket System (GMLRS) or the 1-missile Army Tactical Missile System (ATACMS), and is interchangeable with the [[M270 MLRS]] which carries two ammunition pods.  The GMLRS has a range up to 57.2 miles (92 km) while the ATACMS has a range up to 190 miles (300 km).

h4. External links

"Wikipedia: M142 HIMARS":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M142_HIMARS]

title: m270_mlrs
body:
The M270 Multiple Launch Rocket System (MLRS) is a armored tracked self-propelled multiple rocket launcher developed for the U.S. Army.  It can carry two ammunition pods that each consist of either the 6-rocket Guided Multiple Launch Rocket System (GMLRS) or the 1-missile Army Tactical Missile System (ATACMS), and are interchangeable with the [[M142 HIMARS]] which carries one ammunition pod.  The GMLRS has a range up to 57.2 miles (92 km) while the ATACMS has a range up to 190 miles (300 km).

As of 2019 the US has been upgrading their existing M270's to the M270A2.  This variant features the new Common Fire Control System (CFCS) and will enable the M270 to be able to use the Precision Strike Missile (PrSM), a replacement for the ATACMS that has a range of over 310 miles (500 km).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: M270 Multiple Launch Rocket System":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M270_Multiple_Launch_Rocket_System]

title: yamato2520
body:
A 1994 OVA sequel to the original [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] [[science fiction]] anime series from the [[1970s (style)|70s]].

[b]Yamato 2520[/b] is set several hundred years after [[uchuu_senkan_yamato|the original Yamato]].

It was created by Nishizaki Yoshinobu, the original producer for the first Yamato TV series. However, Nishizaki was sued by [[Matsumoto Leiji]] for breach of copyright, since Matsumoto owns parts of the rights to the franchise and Nishizaki did not ask for his permission to create this sequel. 

Ultimately, Yamato 2520 was left unfinished after only three episodes (of ten planned) were released and the series was cancelled indefinitely. The first OVA episode was released in November 21, 1994. The last OVA (episode 3) was released in August 25, 1996. Each episode is 60 minutes long.

The OVA series features mechanical designs by [[Syd Mead]] and a soundtrack by jazz musician David Matthews.

h4.External Link

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yamato_2520]

body:
"The Flehmen response is a behavior in which an animal curls back its upper lip exposing its front teeth, inhales with the nostrils usually closed, and then often holds this position for several seconds."
"The behavior facilitates the transfer of pheromones and other scents into the vomeronasal organ (VNO, or Jacobson's organ) located above the roof of the mouth via a duct which exits just behind the front teeth of the animal."
(from Wikipedia)

title: linn_kurosawa
body:
One of the main playable characters from the [[Alien vs. Predator]] science fiction action and horror [[video game]] created by [[Capcom]] in 1994.

Lieutenant [b]Linn Kurosawa[/b] is a female [[cyborg]] [[Colonial Marine]] who fights against the [[Xenomorph]]s during the game. 

She is a member of the 13th Colonial Marine Corps and an expert in the use of ancient [[martial arts]], [[katana]] swords and [[handgun]]s.

In the AVP game her character is the weakest and less resilient but also the fastest and has the bigger amount of special moves. She is more suitable for advanced and more experienced players.

h4. See also

* [[Dutch Schaefer]]

title: dutch_schaefer
body:
One of the main playable characters from the [[Alien vs. Predator]] science fiction action and horror [[video game]] created by [[Capcom]] in 1994.

Major [b]Dutch Schaefer[/b] is a [[cyborg]] [[Colonial Marine]] who fights against the [[Xenomorph]]s during the game. 

He is armed with a powerful [[arm cannon]] that replaces his original arm that he lost in battle during the First Human-Alien War.

His name is a homage to [b]Alan "Dutch" Schaefer[/b], the main character from the first Predator movie played by [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]].

In the AVP game his character is very resilient and powerful but also the slowest.

He wears a [[cowboy hat]] and a [[red scarf]]. Bluegrass is armed with a sonic weapon in the shape of a variable [[electric guitar]] that can transform into a support robot eagle called Sideman.

title: silverhawks
body:
[b]SilverHawks[/b] is an American [[science fiction]] animated television series developed by Rankin/Bass Productions and distributed by Lorimar-Telepictures in 1986.

The cartoon follows the adventures of the SilverHawks, a group of [[cyborg]] law enforcers in the far reaches of space. 

In total, 65 episodes were made. It was created as a [[space]]-bound equivalent of their previous series, [[ThunderCats]].

The animation of the show is notable because it actually was provided by Japanese studio Pacific Animation Corporation and was made in an 80s anime influenced art style. 

As was the case with ThunderCats, there was also a SilverHawks comic book series published by then-[[Marvel]] Comics imprint Star Comics.

Currently, Warner Bros. (who purchased Lorimar in 1989) owns the rights to SilverHawks and other TV series made by Lorimar.

title: pacific_animation_corporation
body:
Original name: パシフィックアニメーション株式会社
Years active: 1985-1989  
Headquarters: Tokyo

Pacific Animation Corporation (PAC) was a Japanese animation studio that produced the Rankin/Bass animated series [[ThunderCats]] and [[SilverHawks]].

PAC was born when "Topcraft", another Japanese animation studio, went bankrupt and dissolved in the mid 1980s. While most of the animators working at Topcraft, including [[Miyazaki Hayao]], left to form [[Studio Ghibli]], the remaining animators formed PAC. The production manager of the newly formed PAC was Masaki Iizuka.

Rankin/Bass, whose TV animated specials "The Last Unicorn", "The Flight of Dragons", and "The Hobbit" were produced by Topcraft, decided to employ the services of PAC for their animated TV show ThunderCats. After the enormous success of ThunderCats, Rankin/Bass continued their collaboration with PAC when they produced SilverHawks.

PAC closed down in 1989 when [[disney|Walt Disney]] bought it to form "Walt Disney Animation Japan".

title: front-tie_top
body:
A front-tie top may refer to a [[bikini]] top (or less commonly, a [[bra]] undergarment such as at post #478758) which closes in front of the chest by two or more ends tied together, forming a knot between the breasts. It may also refer to a [[tied_shirt|plain shirt]] or [[crop_top|crop top]] tied in the same manner, forming a type of [[halterneck]] which both emphasizes the resulting bare [[midriff]] and the bustline or [[cleavage]]. Variations may be purely ornamental in nature rather than functional (e.g. [[bow bra]], post #490346), mostly theoretical (a mere ribbon at post #652439), or may feature a [[o-ring_top|metal loop]] to help connect bra cups together and tie to a neck strap.

The term could arguably be used to describe a [[corset]], [[bustier]] or other similar garment which features a frontal latticework that, in turn, terminates in a central knot (e.g. post #419234).

h4. See also

* [[Front-tie bikini top]]
* [[Tied shirt]]
* [[Clothes around waist]]
* [[Tag group:attire]]

title: hinomoto_reiko
body:
The protagonist of [i][[Rumble Roses]][/i]. Voiced by [[Hidaka Noriko]]. Her Heel version is [[Rowdy Reiko]].

Reiko enters the Rumble Roses tournament after her mother and sister disappear.

Reiko has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[medium breasts]], the left one having a [[mole on breast|mole]]. Her wrestling outfit consists of a [[red choker]] (sometimes a [[red scarf|scarf]] in illustrations), a [[red bikini]] top, [[red gloves|red]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[red shorts|red]] [[short shorts]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[knee boots]] that are [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]]. Her shorts are [[open fly|unzipped]], revealing her [[white panties]].

The first kanji on Reiko's name, "零", means "zero", which is alluded in her outfit, as both her panties and bikini top have the word "Zero" on them.

When fighting in a [[swimsuit]], she wears a [[front-tie bikini top|front]] and [[side-tie bikini bottom|side-tie]] [[polka dot bikini|polka-dotted]] [[white bikini]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[high heels]].

title: flan-maman_(goma)
body:
An [[original]] [[Touhou]] character created by [[Goma (Gomasamune)]]. An [[aged up]], married, motherly [[Flandre Scarlet]].

She is the mother of [[Mikoto Freesia Scarlet (goma)|]], and the wife of the [[Admiral (kancolle)|Kantai Collection Admiral]]. She is somewhat less violent than her younger self, though certainly not completely docile, and she is highly prone to [[yandere]] moments if she suspects that her husband might be unfaithful.

Flan-maman typically wears no [[hat]], and her more elaborate [[hair ribbon]] is gone, but she still has a [[side ponytail]] held together with a [[scrunchie]]. She typically wears more [[casual]], [[contemporary]] clothing; usually a [[ribbed sweater]] and [[pants]].

Keeping the theme started by Flandre's French-sounding name, "maman" is French for "mom".

Use only if the post is tagged with フランママン, as even some [[aged up]]-looking [[Flandre Scarlet]] drawn by [[Goma (Gomasamune)]] are not intended to be Flan-maman.

title: suwa_amaki
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Kurenai no Majo-tachi]], although she had a few cameo appearances in other instalments of the franchise prior. Younger sister of [[Suwa Masuzu]] and older sister of [[Suwa Goshiki]].

A Pilot Officer from Fuso serving in the [[504th Joint Fighter Wing]]. Friends with [[Nakajima Nishiki]] and [[Nakajima Hayate]]'s girlfriend. She's known for being a klutz
Her familiar is the fox, her weapon is a Ho-130 machine gun, and she's based on the Kawasaki Ki-61 plane (nicknamed Hien, flying swallow).

title: nakajima_hayate
body:
Character from [[World Witches Series]] manga Strike Witches: Soku no Otome-tachi and [[Tenkuu no Otome-tachi]]. She was a member of the [[504th Joint Fighter Wing]] in the latter, but this was later retconned.

A Flight Student at Fussa Academy, she's the younger sister of [[Nakajima Nishiki]],a close friend of [[Suwa Goshiki]], and [[Suwa Amaki]]'s girlfriend.

Her familiar is a cat, and she's based on the Nakajima Ki-84 plane.

title: karibuchi_takami
body:
Character from [[Brave Witches]].

Flight Lieutenant serving in the 508th Joint Fighter Wing. She possesses the skill to detect a [[Neuroi]]'s core through infrared thermography. She was to be transferred to the [[502nd Joint Fighter Wing]] as they were in need of a witch with an eye skill, but an injury caused her sister [[Karibuchi Hikari]] to be sent in her place. She also has another skill called Absolute Eye, which allows her to use large amounts of energy to increase her perception and analytical capabilities. Her hair and eyes turn red when she uses it.

Her weapons are a  Solothurn S-18/100 anti-tank cannon, and Type 99-2 cannon Model 2 Kai. Her familiar is the red crane, and she's based on Oshibushi Takashi.

title: karibuchi_hikari
body:
Main character of [[Brave Witches]].

Originally a student at Sasebo, she was inducted into the [[502nd Joint Fighter Wing]] as a Sergeant as replacement for her sister [[Karibuchi Takami]]. She has a skill called Contact Eye which allows her to see a [[Neuroi]]'s core by touching it.

Her weapons are a Type 99-2 cannon Model 2 Kai, a Solothurn S-18/100 anti-tank cannon, and a FP-45 "Liberator" pistol. Her familiar is a Fuso squirrel, and she's based on Oshibuchi Hikari, younger sister of Oshibuchi Takashi.

title: ferrari_512bb
body: The Ferrari Berlinetta Boxer (BB) is series of sports cars produced by Ferrari in Italy between 1973 and 1984. The BB was designed by Leonardo Fioravanti at Pininfarina. The first BB model, the 365 GT4 BB, replaced the front engined Daytona and was the first in a series of road-going Ferraris equipped with a mid-mounted flat-twelve engine. It was also the first mid-engined road-car to bear the Ferrari name and the Cavallino Rampante (prancing horse) logo. The 365 GT4 BB was succeeded in 1976 by the BB 512, equipped with a larger displacement engine, then by the fuel-injected BB 512i in 1981. The series was discontinued in 1984 when the BB 512i was replaced by the Testarossa, which used a revised version of the flat-twelve engine.

title: nora_taylor
body:
Character from [[Brave Witches]]. A witch born in Australis and based on Norman Taylor.

Learned to fly by playing with an old striker unit owned by her mother. (Did not receive proper flying instructions.)

Volunteered for service to Britannia, assigned to 760 NAS (Naval Air Squadron), as a probationary Sergeant.
Skilled swimmer and horse rider.

Later assigned to 804 NAS to escort a convoy bound for Orussia in the lead up to Operation Barbarossa.
Due to the lack of purpose built / fitted ship, she was catapulted from a transport, engaged a Neuroi, then either crashed into a ships mast or was shot down.

The convoy was saved by members of the [[502nd Joint Fighter Wing]] who were sent to meet up with the convoy and escort it the remainder of its journey.

title: ottobas
body:
Ottobas are a beast from [[Made in Abyss]].

The Ottobas are large amphibious [[animal|animals]] that live deep within the bottom of the 2nd layer of the Abyss, in the area around the borders of the Inverted Forest. They somewhat resemble modern-day real life pachyderms such as hippopotamuses or rhinoceroses.

title: nakikabane
body:
Corpse-Weepers (Nakikabane, ナキカバネ) are a type of [[monster]] from [[Made in Abyss]].

They are large [[bird|birds]] that live in the 2nd layer of the Abyss, in the Forest of Temptation.

Corpse-Weepers are carnivorous and quite violent at that. They are notorious for their capabilities to mimic sounds and use it for hunting. If they capture prey with high social capabilities such as Hammerbeaks or humans, they will learn their prey's cries for help and use it to lure others to their colony, thus giving them the name,

title: shiggy_(made_in_abyss)
body:
Shiggy is a character from [[Made in Abyss]].

He is an orphan from the Belchero Orphanage in the town at the edge of the Abyss, Orth.

He has [[short hair|short]] ashy [[black hair]] and bright-[[red eyes]], wears [[round eyewear|rounded]] [[glasses]], and bears a red [[whistle]] around his neck. He is often seen in his [[white shirt|plain white]] sailor collar shirt and khaki green or [[black pants]] and track shoes.

title: natt_(made_in_abyss)
body:
Nat is a character from [[Made in Abyss]].

He is an orphan from the Belchero Orphanage in the town at the edge of the Abyss, Orth.

He has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with bright [[blue eyes]] and wears, like his peers, a red [[whistle]] around his neck. He is often seen in his [[white shirt|plain white]] sailor collar shirt, [[green pants]], and track shoes.

title: gokouge
body:
The Silkfang (Gokouge, ゴコウゲ) is a [[monster]] from [[Made in Abyss]]

It is a large [[bug|insect]] that is occasionally seen within the 1st layer of the Abyss. It has a 10-meter dome-shaped territory, and puts its sticky feelers inside of it. They use it as a trap to catch their prey when they carelessly enter their territory.

title: prushka_(furry)
body:
[b]Prushka ([[furry]])[/b] is a [[furrification|Narehate interpretation]] of [[Prushka]] from [[Made in Abyss]].

Narehate Prushka is not a canon Made in Abyss character, but she has been featured in some official illustrations by the manga's author [[Tsukushi Akihito]]. Most notably, she has been depicted in a bonus illustration in volume 5 of the manga receiving the Blessing of the Abyss and becoming a Narehate.

title: wazukyan_(human)
body:
Wazukyan is a character from [[Made in Abyss]].

He is one of The Three Sages, the ones who created Ilblu. He can speak the language of Delvers

As a human, he had a bulky, commanding figure and very sharp facial features. He had a [[beard]] that framed his face and [[hair_slicked_back|slicked back hair]]. His [[facial_tattoo|face]] was covered in [[tattoo|tattoos]] and he had [[bags_under_eyes|large bags]] under his half lidded eyes.

h4. See also
* [[Wazukyan]]

title: belafu_(human)
body:
Belaf is a character from [[Made In Abyss]].

He is one of the Three Sages of Ilblu. As human, he used to be one of the key members of the Ganja Suicide Corps and is now one of Ilblu's most important residents.

As a human, Belaf was thin and tall. He had wild [[white hair]] and a large [[scar]] across the left side of his [[scar_on_face|face]]. His eyes were [[blue eyes|light blue]] colored and he always had an intense expression on his face.

title: belafu
body:
Belafu is a character from [[Made In Abyss]].

He is one of the Three Sages of Ilblu. As [[belafu_(human)|human]], he used to be one of the key members of the Ganja Suicide Corps and is now one of Ilblu's most important residents.

Belaf has a long, centipede-like body and a head reminiscent of a flower. He has almost no facial features except for what is at first glance two empty eye sockets, but are actually more akin to mouths. A proboscis-like tube protrudes from each hole to eat and his voice also comes from these openings.

body:

A Flight Lieutenant from the Suomus Air Force 3rd Mechanized Air Infantry Battalion 1st Air Squadron. She commonly works with the [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]] even as she looks down on them. Her squadron is her personal harem, and she's interested in [[Sakomizu Haruka]]. Her name is peculiar as her fisrt name is male, while her surname contains "aho", which sounds funny to Fusoans.

She has no known familiar or archetype.

title: heidimarie_w._schnaufer
body:
Heidemarie W. Schnaufer is a character from [[Strike Witches]]. She debuted in the Kimi to Tsunagaru Sora manga, but is more known for her appearance in the movie.

Flight Lieutenant from the Karlsland Air Force 1st Night Fighter Wing 4th Flying Corps. She has long [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]], wears [[glasses]] with a black [[military uniform]] and black [[thighhighs]], and has [[head wings]]. She's also noted for her quiet nature, pale skin, and being [[large breasts|well endowed]].

She is a [[hirschgeweih_antennas|Night Witch]] who fights with a Mauser MG213 revolver cannon. Her familiar is the "gyrfalcon":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gyrfalcon. She is based on the German night fighter ace "Heinz-Wolfgang Schnaufer":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heinz-Wolfgang_Schnaufer.

It stars the Suomus Independent Volunteer Aerial Squadron (later renamed the [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]]). In theory an elite international squad, most of its members were in fact sent there for bad behaviour, and as result it came to be known as the "Suomus Misfits Squad".

title: charlotte_lueder
body:

A Sergeant from Karlsland, and the first operator of the land-based [[Striker unit]] "Tiger". She comes from an ancient family of Karlslandian witches, but this information was kept secret and she was presented as a Liberion for propaganda purposes regarding the Liberion-made Tiger.

Her weapons are a 75mm KhK 40 L/48 Witch Combat Gun and a .88mm KwK 36 Tank Gun. Her familiar is apparently a cat, and she's based on Hans-Georg Lueder.

body:
Character from [[World Witches Series]]. She debuted in [[Witches of Africa]] and appeared in the Operation Victory Arrow OVAs.

Group Captain from the Karlsland Air Force 27th Fighter Wing 1st Flying Corps. She's the overall Commander of all Witches in North Africa and reports to Erwin Rommel.

Her weapons are MG34 and MG42 mahine guns. Her familiar is the Lipizanner horse, and she's based on Eduard Neumann.

title: succubus_adventurer_yuze
body:
Yuze is a succubus adventurer.

It is customary for a succubus to take a career in dream therapies or show business these days. After all, they need men's energy to survive. However, Yuze always held unmatched curiosity towards the outer world. The stories of dragon slayers always excited her more than that of a popular actress. Despite concerns from those around her, she made a bold choice to become an adventurer.

Despite having a pure adventuring soul, she still is a succubus. She often says things that may make others' faces red without realizing. Her innocent actions are often misconstrued as being seductive.
other_names: ユズ(ガーディアンテイルズ)

title: innkeeper_loraine
body:
Loraine is the owner of the Kanterbury inn which is well known among adventurers for its high-quality services. She will always greet you with a smile full of kindness but with a hint of darkness.

No one knows much about her. Her past, age, where she is from, what race she is - nothing. Even when you witness her die right in front of you, she'll be ready to greet you back at the inn.

There is one rule when you stay at her inn. Never look up while you are eating.
other_names: ロレイン(ガーディアンテイルズ)

title: summer_innkeeper_loraine
body:
Loraine, the innkeeper who'll gift everyone unforgettable memories this summer!

She works without rest and always greets adventurers with a mysterious smile. Loraine never shows it, but even she wants to take a break without having a worry in the world. There just wasn't any available time for her.

Loraine finally decided to go on vacation she'd been putting off for years, and she built an amusement android that only existed in a blueprint for the first time. That's how a specialized android AA72, different from the MK series tasked with battle or housework came to be. Loraine was so touched from how the AA series would actively search out tasks. She ordered a specially made swimsuit from Kamazon for it to wear.

When AA72 disappeared on the beach, Loraine lost her usual composure and became quite flustered. An android running away was unprecedented. On top of that, a cooling device, which was AA72's major component, had gotten loose. She immediately sent androids to search the beach, and even asked for help from the lifeguard. Loraine didn't expect the lifeguard would run away with AA72.

After she returned to Heavenhold from vacation, Loraine first established a duty hand-off procedure for androids. Various improvements in different fields, such as enhanced hand-off procedures, additional monitoring systems, and duty confirmation systems were added to prevent similar incidents from occuring. Some androids complained about how their vacation made more troublesome tasks, but all of them fell silent after they had a meeting with Loraine.

This year's 'Summer Focus' picked Loraine as ’The top hottest trending woman'. Sohee caused a scene asking why she wasn't picked for 1st place while Loraine said such rankings are meaningless. According to a testimony from a maid android, she found a mysterious album in Loraine's room. The Focus special article about Loraine is preciously placed within the album.
other_names: 夏の旅館の主ロレイン

body:
Hanna U. Rudel is a character from [[Strike Witches: Suomus Misfits Squadron]]. She has long light [[brown hair|brown]]/[[blonde hair]] and [[brown eyes]] and has a [[scar]] across her nose.

A colonel from Karlsland Air Force 2nd Dive-Bomber Wing 3rd Flying Corps who specializes in anti-ground combat, she is considered the best ground attack witch in the world. 

Her weapon is a BK 3,7 anti-tank cannon. Her familiar is the wolf, and she's based on Hans-Ulrich Rudel.

body:

Pilot Officer in the Karlsland Air Force 26th Heavy Fighter Wing. 

Her weapon is an MK-108 cannon. Her familiar is a black cat, and she's based on Alfred Schreiber, noted for claiming the first aerial victory by a jet fighter in aviation history.

title: takeuchi_mariya
body:
Takeuchi Mariya (born 20 March 1955) is a Japanese singer and songwriter known during the late 1970s and 1980s for her City Pop songs.

Mariya later gained Internet fame in 2017 when one of her City Pop songs, "Plastic Love":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plastic_Love], was uploaded to YouTube, gaining over 24 million views and in turn not only propelling Plastic Love back into the public conscious, but also inspiring fanart based on the thumbnail, which used the cover of the single release of "[[SWEETEST MUSIC]]".

Thanks to Plastic Love's popularity, "an official music video":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T_lC2O1oIew] was released on 12 November 2021.

body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Suomus Misfits Squadron]].

A Flight Sergeant from the Karlsland Air Force. One of the first testers of Jet Strikers. Noted for her deep admiration of [[Gertrud Barkhorn]] due to her similar strict and nagging personality. [[Erica Hartmann]] calls her "Mini-Trude".

Her weapons are a MK108 cannon, a MG213, a MG42, and a MG131. Her familiar  is a black cat, and she's based on Helmut Lennartz.

title: kuji_kanesada
body: [[Miyafuji Yoshika]]'s familiar in [i][[Strike Witches]][/i]. He only appears in the [i]Strike Witches[/i] pilot OVA and the (retroactively non-canonical) manga series [i]Maidens in the Sky[/i]. Although he appears as a small grey [[shiba inu]], often wearing a World War II-era Japanese enlisted sailor's hat, he is in fact the spirit of an ancient sword that was once used to banish a [[Neuroi]]. Personality-wise, Kuji is depicted as mischievous, willful, and sharing Yoshika's fondness for [[breasts]].

title: adolfine_galland
body:
Adolfine Galland is a character from [[Strike Witches Zero]].

She is a Witch attached with the Karlsland Air Force. Out of all the Witches who belong to the modern states' military organizations, she has the highest rank, being an Air Marshall. She is famous for the behavior of saying whatever she wants.

The only witch to wear fully-fledged pants, in reference to Adolf Galland often piloting pantless. She possesses a Magic Eye that raises her concentration and accuracy when she sees though the GwZF4 rifle scope she carries around.

Her ace archetype is "Adolf Galland":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adolf_Galland. Her weapons are MG42 and Bren light machine guns, and her familiar appears to be a wildcat.
other_names: アドルフィーネ・ガランド

title: yokokawa_kazumi
body:
Character from [[World Witches Series]]. First seen in supplemental material before having a cameo in Contrail of Witches.

A Pilot Officer from the Fuso Imperial Navy who was the flight instructor for [[Nishizawa Yoshiko]]. Her familiar appears to be a dog of some sorts, and she's based on Yokoyama Tamotsu.

title: nishizawa_yoshiko
body:
Character from [[World Witches Series]], from the manga Contrail of Witches.

A Warrant Officer from the Fuso Imperial Navy. Known as the Demon of Libau, she's a hyperactive and reckless girl with a great talent for flying and air maneuvers. [[Sakamoto Mio]], [[Takei Junko]], and [[Kanno Naoe]] all look up to her.

Her weapons are a Type 99-2 cannon Model 2 Kai and a Fuso Sword. Her familiar is a domestic cat, and she's based on Nishizawa Hiroyoshi.

title: kitagou_fumika
body:
Character form [[Strike Witches Zero]] and [[Brave Witches]].

Squadron Leader of the Fuso Imperial Navy 12th Flying Corps Kitagou Unit. Instructor of [[Sakamoto Mio]], [[Takei Junko]], and [[Wakamoto Tetsuko]]. Mio modeled herself after her. She and her friend [[Etou Toshiko]] were injured during the Fuso Sea Incident. After retirement she became headmistress of Sasebo Aviation School where [[Karibuchi Hikari]] and [[Misumi Miya]] studied.

Her weapons are a Lewis Gun and two Fuso swords which gave her name nickname of "War God". Her familiar appears to be a dog of some sorts, and she's based on Mochifumi Nangou.

She is a household [[android]] for [[Sakisaka Rikuo]] and [[Sakisaka Naoko]]. She has [[brown eyes]] and [[brown hair]], she wears in a [[ponytail]].

She is voiced by [[Tanaka Rie]].

title: suwa_goshiki
body:
Character from [[World Witches Series]] manga Strike Witches: Soku no Otome-tachi and [[Tenkuu no Otome-tachi]]. She was a member of the [[504th Joint Fighter Wing]] in the latter, but this was later retconned.

A Flight Student at Fussa Academy, younger sister of [[Suwa Masuzu]] and [[Suwa Amaki]], and close friends with [[Nakajima Hayate]].

Her familiar is a fox, and she's based on the Ki-100 plane, which is a Type-5 (goshiki) fighter.

title: nakajima_nishiki
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Kurenai no Majo-tachi]], although she had a few cameo appearances in other instalments of the franchise prior.

A Pilot Officer from Fuso serving in the 504th Joint Fighter Wing. Older sister of [[Nakajima Hayate]]. Commonly seen alongside [[Suwa Amaki]].
Her familiar is the ocelot, her weapons are a Ho-103 machine gun and a Ho-301 cannon, and she's based on the Nakajima Ki-44 plane.

title: suwa_masuzu
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches Zero]].

Flying Officer in the Fuso Imperial Army 47th Independent Fighter Company. Older sister and surrogate mother of [[Suwa Amaki]] and [[Suwa Goshiki]].

She's based on the Kawasaki Ki-60 plane.

title: katou_takeko
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches Zero]] who debuted in [[Strike Witches: Suomus Misfits Squadron]]. Nicknamed Fuji based on an alternate reading of her surname, to distinguish her from the unrelated [[Katou Keiko]].

 A Pilot officer from Fuso who was serving in the Fuso Imperial Army 1st Fighter Squadron at the time of the Fuso Sea Incident. Known as the Peregrine Falcon of the Fuso Sea, she has the same Three-Dimensional Space Understanding skill as [[Minna Dietlinde-Wicke]].

Her weapons are a Type 11 Light Machine Gun, a MG 15 machine gun, and a Fuso Sword. Her familiar is the Hokkaido dog, and she's based on Katou Tateo.

Wing Commander of the Fuso Imperial Army 1st Fighter Squadron. She was injured during the Fuso Sea Incident and opened a cafe after retiring. Close friends with [[Kitagou Fumika]].

Her familiar is assumed to be a cat of some sorts, and she's based on Katou Toshio.

title: chesed_(project_moon)
body:
Sephirah of the Welfare Team in Lobotomy Corporation and Patron Librarian of the Floor of Social Science in Library of Ruina. He was easygoing but sleepy and cynical in LB, then becomes more relaxed and casual in LoR. Loves [[coffee]] and is always seen [[holding cup|holding]] a [[coffee mug]]. 

In [[Lobotomy Corporation]], he has [[blue hair|blue]], [[medium hair|medium-length hair]] with [[curtained hair]] and [[brown eyes]].
His outfit consists of a [[blue coat]], [[double-breasted]] [[grey vest]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[blue ascot]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

In [[Library of Ruina]], his hair grows [[long hair|longer]] and tied into a [[low ponytail]]. 
His outfit is slightly changed. He no longer wears his vest and instead of white he wears an [[untucked shirt|untucked]] [[black shirt|black]] [[collared shirt]].

title: pili_budaixi
body:
Pīlì Bùdàixì is a long-running Taiwanese puppet-based TV series, debuting in 1984.

A remake of the sixth season from 1990 released in 2019, known as [[Pili Fantasy]]: War of Dragons, having since become its own continuity distinct from the main Pili series. It was followed up by Pili Fantasy: Doom of Dragons in 2020. These installments are the first to air in English-speaking countries in an uncut format, via [[Netflix]].

The creators of the series collaborated with Nitroplus, Good Smile Company and Gen Urobuchi to create [[Thunderbolt Fantasy]].

Kobushi Kiku is an original character created by [[Rimiko]]. It is viewed as one of the many concept appearances for the [[vocaloid|VOCALOID2]] product [[VY1]], though it should be noted that the current VY series have no official avatars.

Her winning design has long, blue-purple [[gradient hair]], and wears a white [[halterneck]] with [[bare midriff|bared midriff]] along with a white/red [[pleated skirt]]. Her black [[bridal gauntlets]] are hidden under white, wide [[detached sleeves]]. She uses [[tengu-geta]] and also carries a [[kokyuu]].

For her redesign, she keeps the halterneck and sleeves, but she gains a red [[hakama short skirt]] and trades her geta for [[high heels]]. Her hair becomes fully [[pink hair|pink]], and she gains white, butterfly-like ribbons to tie it.

A dog tag is the informal name for the identification tags worn by military personnel, because of their resemblance to actual "dog tags":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pet_tag]. They are also used as fashion accessories.

title: daedalus
body:
A fictional [[military]] sea ship from the [[MACROSS]] series.

The [b]SLV-111 Daedalus Super-Large-Scale Semi-Submersible Assault Landing Vessel[/b] is a type of [[U.N. Spacy]] naval ship built as a semi-submersible assault carrier deployed by the U.N. Forces in the ocean surrounding [[South Ataria]] island. 

The ship's main feature was a collapsible ramp extending from the bow of the ship outward, designed to load the [[Destroid]] series mecha and then promptly sortie Destroids upon arrival at an enemy base. The Daedalus is 0.4 km long. It also serves as the SDF-1's Right Arm.

In [[real life]] , this ship was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

h4. See also

* [[SDF-1]]

title: pixel-perfect_duplicate
body:
A post that is completely identical to its parent, and was either uploaded afterwards or has no source while their parent does, and thus is inferior for Danbooru purposes.

Pixiv and Twitter posts are often identical, even if they have different filesizes. In 2019 Twitter stopped compressing as harshly as they used to, and in late 2020 Pixiv started losslessly recompressing their JPGs to strip metadata, so typically if there's only a few KBs of difference between two identical pictures from these two sites, it means they're the same exact image.

To check if two similar images are pixel-perfect duplicates, use https://duplicatebooru.zipfiled.info.

This tag is automatically populated and should not be removed by users.

[b]Do not flag posts just because they are under this tag if they come from a first-party source.[/b]

AdventureQuest Worlds is an online browser-based MMORPG created in 2008 by [[artix_entertainment|Artix Entertainment]] and is still updated on a weekly basis.

The main saga, also known as the "[b]13 Lord of Chaos Saga[/b]", revolves around The Hero on the middle of a war between Good and Evil. During a fight between the leader of both sides, an unexpected side, Chaos, joins the fight and ends up killing the leader of the Evil Faction, [b]Sepulchure[/b], so his daughter, [[gravelyn|Gravelyn]] becomes the new Empress of Evil. At the end of this, The Hero must pick a side and make his way towards the objective of defeating a major threat: [b]Drakath, the Chaos Champion[/b]. title: sudare
body:
Sudare (簾/すだれ) are traditional Japanese screens or blinds, made of horizontal slats of decorative wood, bamboo, or other natural material, woven together with simple string, colored yarn, or other decorative material to make nearly solid blinds Sudare can be either rolled or folded up out of the way. They are also sometimes called misu (御簾/みす), particularly if they have a green fabric hem. Yoshizu, non-hanging sudare, are made of vertical slats of common reed and used as screen.

Sudare are used in many Japanese homes to shield the verandah and other openings of the building from sunlight, rain, and insects. They are normally put up in spring and taken down again in autumn. Their light structure allows breezes to pass through, a benefit in the hot Japanese summers. Since the building materials are easy to find, sudare can be made cheaply.

Elaborate sudare for palaces and villas used high-quality bamboo, with expensive silk and gold embroidery worked in.

An American animated web television series developed by Noelle Stevenson and produced by DreamWorks Animation Television. It premiered on November 13, 2018 on Netflix. Part of the [[Masters of the Universe]] franchise.

Like the 1985 Filmation series [[She-Ra Princess of Power]] of which it is a reboot, the series tells the tale of the teenager Adora's rebellion against the evil [[Hordak]] and his Horde, in the guise of the heroine [[She-Ra]] and leading a group of other magical princesses. The series was well-received by critics, who praised it for its diverse cast and the portrayal of She-Ra's rivalry with her former best friend [[Catra]].

body:
Bunny Day is a [[date pun]] that occurs on August 2nd or 21st.

"バニー" (banii) looks similar to the numerals 八二一, which respectively mean 8, 2, and 1. The same pun can also result from goroawase: 8 (ba) + 2 (ni) and 8 (ba) + 2 (ni) + 1 (i).

Some also designate August 23rd as Bunny Day or "Banii-san no Hi" using goroawase: 8 (ba) + 2 (ni) + 1 (i) + 3 (san).

title: c-string
body:
A [[strapless bottom|strapless]] [[thong]] shaped like a C, playing on the word [[g-string]]. The c-string uses a flexible frame to hold itself to the body without straps to avoid [[tanlines]].

Generally, this would preclude a [[cameltoe]] but rules of artistic license apply. If a potential c-string doesn't continue all the way up into a back thong "strap" or if it clings too tightly to the body, it might be a [[maebari]] instead.

title: uchuu_senkan_yamato_2202:_ai_no_senshi-tachi
body:
[b]Space Battleship Yamato 2202: Warriors of Love[/b] (宇宙戦艦ヤマト2202 愛の戦士たち, [i]Uchū Senkan Yamato Ni-ni-zero-ni Ai no Senshi-tachi[/i]) , also known in the West as [b]Star Blazers 2202[/b], is a Japanese [[military]] [[science fiction]] produced by [[Production IG]] and animated film series animated by XEBEC, and the sequel to [[uchuu_senkan_yamato_2199|Star Blazers: Space Battleship Yamato 2199]], originally based on the [[uchuu_senkan_yamato|Space Battleship Yamato]] television series created by Nishizaki Yoshinobu and [[Matsumoto Leiji]]. 

It is directed by Habara Nobuyoshi ([[soukyuu_no_fafner|Fafner in the Azure]]) and written by Fukui Harutoshi ([[Mobile Suit]] [[Gundam Unicorn]]) with official character designs by Yuki Nobuteru.

The first film of the series was released simultaneously in Japanese theaters and streaming services starting February 25, 2017. Similar to the first film series, the second loosely adapts both the animated series Space Battleship Yamato II and the movie Arrivederci Yamato.

A regular  26 episode TV series adaptation aired from October 6, 2018 until March 30, 2019. It was [[XEBEC]]'s final anime series before the company's closure in May 2019.

h4.Sequel
* [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2205: Arata Naru Tabidachi]]

h4.See also

Website: http://www.yamato2202.net/
other_names: 宇宙戦艦ヤマト2202愛の戦士たち

title: hatsukoi_1/1
body:
Hatsukoi 1/1 is an adult game developed by tone work's.

Yuuma is a second year student at the prestigious public school Hoshioka Gakuen. It is known for offering a fulfilling school life, but he has yet to experience love and spends his days lacking any satisfaction. He hasn’t made any progress with his classmates nor his osananajimi. All he can do is look at his love interest, the student council leader Midori, from a distance.

One day, he saw her with a troubled face. It seemed that the remaining members of the school cafeteria improvement committee had resigned. After giving it some thought, he volunteered to lead the committee. After that fateful moment, his surroundings became a lot more lively and before long, his first love had blossomed.

[From Hau~ Omochikaeri!]

h4. Characters
* [[Fujikawa Runa]]
* [[Tokizaki Maya]]
* [[Morino Yukino]]
* [[Makabe Midori]]
* [[Tsukishima Kyou]]

title: harukaze_sensation!
body:
The human world has friendly relations with both the barren demon world and the lushly-forested spirit world. This spring, the demon king’s third son, Touma, came to study abroad at Shikikaze Gakuen in the human world. It was his first time in another world and he was excited to gain more experience for the future. Shortly thereafter, a student from the spirit world, Haruka, asked him to be her husband. Now, a spring breeze is blowing through the human world.

[From Hau~ Omochikaeri!]

title: game_(=eroge)_mitai_na_suteki_na_koi_ga_shitai!
body:
Takamiya Haruto, a university student, is requested by his older sister to help out at the company she works in. When he gets there, he learns something astonishing: The company his sister works at — It's an eroge company!

His sister was among the staff of Ramune soft, an eroge studio.
Their latest production almost complete, they're so busy they'd even take cat's helping hand. Even though he has zero knowledge; Haruto accepts, unable to decline, and begins working at Ramune soft.

But, surprisingly...
Ramune soft's staff were all women.
Surrounded by charming women who passionately work on eroge, can Haruto experience wonderful romance like in a game (=eroge)?

Translated from DLsite

title: fire_emblem:_mystery_of_the_emblem
body:
The third game in the [[Fire Emblem]] series, released in 1994 for the Super Famicom.

The game is divided into two distinct parts, or "books". Book One is a remake of the original [[Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon and the Blade of Light]], and Book Two is a continuation of events, following the same characters. Book One was later remade again as [[Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon]] and Book Two was remade as [[Fire Emblem: New Mystery of the Emblem]].

title: hanna-justina_marseille
body:
[b]Hanna-Justina Marseille[/b] (Full name — [b]Hanna-Justina Wallia Rosalind Sieglinde Marseille[/b]) is a character from [[Witches Of Africa]] and [[Strike Witches]].

She has long [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]] and wears a black uniform with a white skirt. Commonly seen wearing a pair of [[goggles]] on her head. Her familiar is a "Steller's Sea Eagle":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steller%27s_sea_eagle, which gives her a pair of [[head wings]].

A legendary witch from Karlsland, who is called the "Star of Africa" due to her stunning looks and extraordinary skill in combat. She has the ability of "deflection shooting", which makes it look like she shoots at empty space and the enemy flies into the bullets of their own volition.

Her ace archetype is "Hans-Joachim Marseille":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hans-Joachim_Marseille. Like Hanna, Hans-Joachim carried the nickname "Star of Africa" and a strong celebrity status for his success in North Africa and his agreeable appearance and personality.

* [[M1934]]

title: cecilia_glinda_miles
body:
Character from [[Witches Of Africa]]. Also known as Major Miles (マイルズ少佐). 

One of the witches who use land-based striker units. She is the commanding officer of the Britannian 4th armored brigade known as "C Company" that is deployed in North Africa. Her weapons are a OQF 2pdr anti-tank cannon and 1796 Light cavalry sabre. Her familiar is the tanuki, and she's based on major C.G. Miles.

title: sugar_stella
body:
Sugar Stella, also referred to as SugaSte (しゅがすて) for short, was a virtual idol group. They were originally part of [[Re:AcT]] but were soon moved to their own office under mikai inc. (the company that manages Re:AcT), called [[STeLLa (mikai inc.)|]].

They have since disbanded due to a breach of contract.

[u]Use this tag when:[/u]
* The image/commentary mentions the name "Sugar Stella".
* The artist deliberately groups [b]all five[/b] of the members (or their respective mascots) together.

title: shigure_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel of [[shigure_(kancolle)|Shigure]].

In her second remodeling, hair flaps have formed in her hair, and she gains a hair decoration (either salvaged from or based upon one of the Fusou sisters' own) and she wears the same uniform as Yuudachi but with a straight tie.

The hairflaps on the sides of her head and the neck piece she wears are near duplicates of those on Yuudachi (and would become a hallmark for all subsequent Shiratsuyu-class remodels), and because of this the two girls are frequently portrayed together, despite the fact that the real ships shared no common operations. The hair flaps also look much like a dog's floppy ears, and because of this she is (and Yuudachi too) often given doggish mannerisms, despite her in-game personality having no doggish mannerisms.

title: yuudachi_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel of [[yuudachi (kancolle)|Yuudachi]] from [[Kantai Collection]].

Easily identifiable with hair flaps, different hair ornaments, and (most tellingly) a white sail on her rigging (a reference to how her crew rigged a white sail for emergency propulsion after being severely damaged in the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal). Personality-wise, slightly more aggressive and itching for a battle than her base form.

Her remodel greatly changes her appearance. Her hair becomes messier, with dog-like hair flaps and a red gradient, and she now wears a hairclip alongside with her ribbon. Her eyes are now red and her clothes become more ornate. It's implied she matures physically as well (this is partially confirmed in the anime), so many fan-artists draw her with far more notable breasts. Furthermore, her firepower's potential is practically on par with some of the heavy cruisers, making her very popular.

title: hanachirusato_(genshin_impact)
body:
Hanachirusato is an NPC in Inazuma appearing exclusively during the questline "Sacred Sakura Cleansing Ritual".

She appeared as a normal shrine maiden with her face hidden behind a fox mask. It was explained that Hanachirusato was part of the condensed "filth" that inherited the memories of the late Kitsune Saiguu and decided to carry out the latter mission despite the natural outcome.

She vanished after the questline, leaving behind her mask as a diagram for a catalyst.

Although her face was never shown, her mask is said to be deeply stained by corruption on the inside.
